content.en: Deformation monitoring: Scientists have developed algorithms that use satellite and ground-based synthetic aperture radar (SAR) data to investigate and monitor ground deformations. These algorithms, such as the small-baseline subset (SBAS) technique and persistent scatterer interferometry, can generate deformation time series and maps of displacement velocities. They are used to study various phenomena, including rockslides, landslides, and surface deformations, providing valuable insights into geophysical processes.
content.da: Deformationsovervågning: Forskere har udviklet algoritmer, der bruger satellit- og jordbaseret syntetisk aperturradar (SAR) data til at undersøge og overvåge jorddeformationer. Disse algoritmer, såsom små-basislinjesubset (SBAS) teknik og permanent scatterer interferometri, kan generere deformations tidsserier og kort over forskydningshastigheder. De bruges til at studere forskellige fænomener, herunder stenfald, jordskred og overfladedeformationer, hvilket giver værdifuld indsigt i geofysiske processer.
